page.title: 09 FARM MACHINERY
page.content: In the last 40 years the use of machinery has been the major change in farming.As recently as 1953,when the present family bought Freshfields,all of the work was done by man power and horse power.In 1953 to run the 600 acre farm 14 agricultural labourers were employed-now only one man is employed.This is partly due to the use of machinery and partly due to the move from dairy farming to the growing of cereal crops. Farmers today have lots of large and expensive machinery such as combine harvesters and tractors with parts that attach on the back like crop sprayers and ploughs. They have their own machinery as they would all want to rent the same equipment at the same time. By Peter Jewkes.
